plant_concentrations.References: (1) Qiu X, Hites RA; Environ Sci Technol 42: 31-6 (2008)
plant_concentrations.Value: Dechlorane plus was detected at 0.025-115 ng/g bark, in pine tree bark samples collected the autumn of 2006 from 26 US locations (Indiana, Massachusetts, Maryland, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia)(1).

plant_concentrations.References: (1) Salamova A, Hites RA; Environ Sci Technol 47: 349-54 (2013)
plant_concentrations.Value: The concentration of dechlorane plus in tree bark from 12 locations around the world(1).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Gauthier LT et al; Environ Sci Technol 41: 4561-7 (2007) (2) Venier M et al; Chemosphere 80: 1234-40 (2010) (3) Gauthier LT, Letcher RJ; Chemosphere 75: 115-20 (2009) (4) Guerra P et al; Environ Sci Technol 45: 1284-90 (2011) (5) Munoz-Amanz J et al; Environ Int 37: 1164-8 (2011) (6) Gentes M-L et al; Environ Sci Technol 46: 9735-44 (2012) (7) Venier M, Hites RA; Environ Sci Technol 45: 4602-8 (2011) (8) Wu J et al; Environ Sci Technol 44: 606-11 (2010)
animal_concentrations.Value: The concentration of dechlorane plus in pooled herring gull eggs (Larus argentatus) collected in 2004 from six Great Lake colonies was 1.7, 1.5, 2.2, 4.2, 4.5 and 2.5 ng/g wet weight at Agawa Rock, Gull Island, Channel-Shelter Island, Fighting Island, Niagara River and Toronto Harbor, respectively(1). Dechlorane plus was detected at 0.02-0.68 ng/g wet weight in the plasma of 6 of 15 nesting bald eagles collected May-Jun 2005 from nesting sites in Michigan along the shores of Lake Superior, Lake Michigan and Lake Huron(2). Herring gull eggs (Larus argentatus), collected over fifteen years spanning 1982-2006 from seven colonies in the Great Lakes, contained dechlorane plus at <1-18 ng/g wet weight(3). In peregrine falcon (Falco peregrinus) eggs collected 2003 to 2006 from Guadalajara and Bilbao, Spain, dechlorane plus was detected at 0.3-17 ng/g lipid; in eggs collected 2007 to 2009 from Lake Superior, Lake Ontario and the St Lawrence River, Canada, dechlorane plus was detected at 6.3-209 ng/g lipid(4). Dechlorane plus was detected at an average concentration of 401 and 105 pg/g wet weight in white stork (Ciconia ciconia) eggs collected from colonies in urban/industrial and rural areas of Spain, respectively(5). Dechlorane plus was not detected (detection limit anti- 0.01 ng/g wet weight, syn- 0.03 ng/g wet weight) in the plasma of ring-billed gulls (Larus delawarensis) collected Apr-Jun 2010 from the St Lawrence River, downstream of Montreal, Canada; anti-dechlorane plus was detected in the liver of all 28 ring-billed gulls at 0.70-38.4 ng/g wet weight and syn-dechlorane plus was detected in the liver of 26 of 28 ring-billed gulls at 0.03-15.2 ng/g wet weight(6). Dechlorane plus was detected at 0.009-0.096 ng/g wet weight in serum samples collected from 13 of 17 dogs in Bloomington, IN(7). Chinese mystery snail (Cipangopaludina chinensis) collected in 2006 from a reservoir near the e-waste recycling plants, South China contained 3.17 and 17.06 ng/g lipid of syn- and anti-dechlorane plus, respectively(8). Water snakes (Enhydris chinensis), collected in the same study, contained 1062 and 909.2 ng/g lipid of the syn- and anti-isomers, respectively(8).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Baron E et al; Environ Sci Technol 49: 9073-83 (2015)
animal_concentrations.Value: Dechlorane plus was measured in the blubber and brain of five species of stranded dolphins collected on the Alboran Sea coastline between 2004 and 2011, results were as follows(1):

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Kubota Y; Ecotoxicol Environ Saf 3: 256-68 (1979) (2) Jia H et al; Environ Sci Technol 45: 2613-8 (2011)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Dechlorane plus was not detected two fish samples collected during a monitoring study in industrial zones located along the Japanese Pacific coast and Japan Sea coast from 1974 to 1976(1). Dechlorane Plus was detected in oyster samples from 14 of 15 locations in Bohai and Huanghai Sea, China, at a mean concentration of 4.1 ng/g wet weight; samples were collected from Oct to Dec 2008(2).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Tomy G et al; Environ Sci Technol 41: 2249-54 (2007)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Dechlorane plus isomers (syn- and anti-) were measured in aquatic samples from the South Basin of Lake Winnipeg, Canada, near the town of Gimli and in aquatic samples from the Canadian side of Lake Ontario(1). The syn-isomer was detected in all samples from both lakes, the anti-isomer was detected in all Lake Ontario samples, but only 45% of the samples from Lake Winnipeg. Mean concentrations were reported as follows(1):
fish_seafood_concentrations.Table: [{'Fish': 'walleye', 'Genus species': 'Stizostedion vitreum', 'No. Sampled': 5, 'syn-isomer (pg/g lipid)': 29, 'anti-isomer (pg/g lipid)': '730'}, {'Fish': 'burbot', 'Genus species': 'Lota lota', 'No. Sampled': 5, 'syn-isomer (pg/g lipid)': 450, 'anti-isomer (pg/g lipid)': '<detection limit'}, {'Fish': 'emerald shiner', 'Genus species': 'Notropis atherinoides', 'No. Sampled': 5, 'syn-isomer (pg/g lipid)': 35, 'anti-isomer (pg/g lipid)': '<detection limit'}, {'Fish': 'whitefish', 'Genus species': 'Coregonus clupeaformis', 'No. Sampled': 5, 'syn-isomer (pg/g lipid)': 30, 'anti-isomer (pg/g lipid)': '24'}, {'Fish': 'white sucker', 'Genus species': 'Catostomus commersonii', 'No. Sampled': 5, 'syn-isomer (pg/g lipid)': 37, 'anti-isomer (pg/g lipid)': '<detection limit'}, {'Fish': 'goldeye', 'Genus species': 'Hiodon alosoides', 'No. Sampled': 5, 'syn-isomer (pg/g lipid)': 56, 'anti-isomer (pg/g lipid)': '760'}, {'Fish': 'zooplankton', 'Genus species': nan, 'No. Sampled': 5, 'syn-isomer (pg/g lipid)': 550, 'anti-isomer (pg/g lipid)': '<detection limit'}, {'Fish': 'mussels', 'Genus species': 'Lampsilis radiata', 'No. Sampled': 5, 'syn-isomer (pg/g lipid)': 430, 'anti-isomer (pg/g lipid)': '<detection limit'}]

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Hoh E et al; Environ Sci Technol 40: 1184-9 (2006) (2) Sverko E et al; Environ Sci Technol 42: 361-6 (2008) (3) Tomy G et al; Environ Sci Technol 41: 2249-54 (2007) (4) Qiu X et al; Environ Sci Technol 41: 6014-9 (2007)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: During a monitoring study of dechlorane plus in the Great Lakes region, the highest concentration of dechlorane plus measured in Lake Erie sediment was 40 ng/g compared to the highest Lake Michigan sediment concentration of 4-6 ng/g(1). Surface sediment samples collected 1997-1998 and 1998 from Lake Erie and Lake Ontario had respective dechlorane plus concentrations of 0.061-8.62 and 2.23-586 ng/g dry weight; reported archived (1980-2002) suspended sediment sample results from the Niagara River showed a maximum concentration of 89 ng/g in 1980 and a minimum concentration of 7 ng/g in 1999(2). The mean concentration of dechlorane plus syn- and anti-isomers in sediment samples collected in 2002 from Lake Winnipeg, Canada were 11.7 and 18.3 pg/g dry weight and from Lake Ontario were 29.6 and 176.4 pg/g dry weight, respectively(3). Sediment core sample collected Jul 2004 from Lake Ontario contained 150 ng/g dry weight of dechlorane plus at the surface and 310 ng/g dry weight at 2-3 cm depth (representing 1994 concentration)(4).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Kubota Y; Ecotoxicol Environ Saf 3: 256-68 (1979) (2) Fang M et al; Sci Totl Environ 481: 114-20 (2014) (3) Wu J et al; Environ Sci Technol 44: 606-11 (2010) (4) Jia H et al; Environ Sci Technol 45: 2613-8 (2011) (5) Wang D et al; Environ Sci Technol 44: 6608-13 (2010) (6) Sun J et al; Sci Total Environ 443: 194-9 (2013) (7) Zhu B et al; Chemosphere 93: 555-60 (2013) (8) Syed JH et al; Chemosphere 93: 1646-53 (2013)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: Dechlorane plus was not detected 53 sediment samples collected during a monitoring study of Japanese industrial zones along the Pacific coast and the Japan Sea coast from 1974 to 1976(1). Sediment samples collected in 2003 from Pohang and Busan Bay, Korea, contained 10-936 and 8-196 pg/g dry weight, respectively(2). Dechlorane plus isomers (syn- and anti-) were detected at 21,820 and 55,320 ng/g organic carbon in surface sediment samples and at 13,130 and 65,660 ng/g organic carbon in suspended sediment samples collected in 2006 from a reservoir near the e-waste recycling plants, South China(3). Dechlorane Plus was detected in sediment samples from 14 of 15 locations in Bohai and Huanghai Sea, China, at a mean concentration of 2.9 ng/g dry weight; samples were collected from Oct to Dec 2008(4). Dechlorane plus concentrations in sediment were reported as 1.86-8.00 ng/g wet weight in samples collected Oct 2009 in the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal, China(5). Surface sediment samples collected May 18 to Jul 11, 2011 from the Qiantang River, China contained dechlorane plus at 0.081-1.1, <0.01-0.54 and 0.55 ng/g dry weight in all 9 urban, 9 of 12 rural and 1 reservoir sample, respectively(6). Sediment samples collected the summer of 2011 from the Lingjiang, Oujiang and Qiantang Rivers, located in the Yangtze River Delta contained 0.591-7.00 ng/g dry weight of dechlorane plus; it was not detected (detection limit 0.330 ng/g dry weight) in samples from the East China Sea(7). Dechlorane plus was detected at 0.3-4.7 ng/g in 20 surface sediment samples collected in 2011 from River Ravi, Pakistan with a mean of 1.9 ng/g(8).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Wang B et al; Chemosphere 80: 1285-90 (2010) (2) Wang D et al; Environ Sci Technol 44: 6608-13 (2010) (3) Syed JH et al; Chemosphere 93: 1646-53 (2013)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: In soil samples collected Oct 2009 from 21 locations in Huai'an, China, dechlorane plus was detected at 0.83-1200 ng/g(1). Dechlorane plus concentrations in soil were reported as 5.11-13,400 ng/g dry weight in samples collected Oct 2009 in the city of Huai'an, China(2). Dechlorane plus was detected at 0.1-15 ng/g in 50 surface soil samples collected in 2011 from 10 sampling sites located along the River Ravi, Pakistan with a mean of 0.8 ng/g(3).
